DOC.criteria: Healthy men , age 18 45 year age , inclusive Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 18 30 kilograms/meter square , inclusive History evidence medical condition potentially alter absorption , metabolism elimination drug History malignancy past 5 year A history clinically significant hypersensitivity ( e.g . drug , excipients ) allergic reaction Any major illness within one month screen examination febrile illness within one week prior screen first study drug administration History presence clinically significant electrocardiogram ( ECG ) abnormalities cardiovascular disease Clinically significant abnormality laboratory test result Confirmed rest pulse rate ( PR ) great 100 less 40 bpm Confirmed systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) great 140 less 90 mm Hg , diastolic blood pressure ( DBP ) great 90 less 50 mm Hg Positive result HIV1 HIV2 , hepatitis C ( HCV ) hepatitis B ( HBV ) History clinically significant gastrointestinal , renal , hepatic , bronchopulmonary , neurological , psychiatric , cardiovascular , endocrinological , ophthalmological , dermatological , hematological allergic disease , metabolic disorder , hypofertility , cancer cirrhosis History evidence ( neuro ) muscular disorder Hypersensitivity itraconazole , ingredient , triazole antifungal Any known contraindication itraconazole
